intro: Phemeranthus mexicanus, commonly known as the Mexican ephemeral, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its short-lived blooms. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its brief flowering period, it is considered a rare and elusive species in its native habitat.
